intro: Drimia oliverorum, commonly known as the Oliver's dragon's tongue, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllis family and is characterized by its striking, sword-shaped leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowering period occurs in late winter to early spring, adding a touch of color to the landscape during the cooler months. Drimia oliverorum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
